Articles.Content: Is that Jam Kerman?
Sure looks like it, Kerbin arbeiter.
I totally agree with you, Undersinker.
Maybe not, Ooltimaet Steev
Is that joeker?

Kerbinorbiter... Munlander...

Wait... Oh,...

The truth is revealed.
So, kerbalooid...
Ah, yes. My dear friend, Josip Kormor.
I dunno how EN-kyu-Em-tee can be misspelled.

It's hard to explain to a person whose nick starts from "J" (what is it? [dzh]? [y]? [kh]? ) and ends with "ph" (why not use just "f"? or you are Indian and this is p^h^?)

At least,"er" and "a" always sound "^j^o" and "ae", this is obvious.

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, kerbiloid said:
> 
> 
> It's hard to explain to a person whose nick starts from "J" (what is it? [dzh]? [y]? [kh]? ) and ends with "ph" (why not use just "f"? or you are Indian and this is p^h^?)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> At least,"er" and "a" always sound "^j^o" and "ae", this is obvious.
> 

When did a "J" get a "K" sound, kerboliod?

> 
> 
> Just now, Joseph Kerman said:
> 
> 
> When did a "J" get a "K" sound, kerboliod?
> 

Not "k", but [kh]

Jose?

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, kerbiloid said:
> 
> 
> Not "k", but [kh]
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Jose?
> 

[kh] is a "K" sound, korbilid.

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, Joseph Kerman said:
> 
> 
> [kh] is a "K" sound, korbilid.
> 

[Depends on a language you speak.](https://www.quora.com/Why-is-there-no-kh-sound-in-English)   

Kharkov sounds [xarkov], not [karkov]

P.S.  

Pronounce your name in Spanish, btw. What's the first sound?

Has to be an "M", am i right, Kirby Lloyd?

I've found you at last!

It's *Game Over, Floater.*
Why did Joan ban Fields?
Hello 9222narwhals. (9 is next to 0 and 1 is next to 2 on a keyboard. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)"))
Okay, maxxcreeaytivv.
Do I get to post a witty response? Not really, Jesph Kermg

Hmm, asby. That's an interesting name.

(danke, autocorrect)
LollalyNotMuhan?

JDSO? Hello.

(This is what happens when you type way too quickly on an iPad...)

max\_kreative?
